reasoning: Standard database migration task using well-configured Alembic tooling. Five new tables with indexes is non-trivial but follows existing patterns. No external integrations or research needed. Medium risk due to database changes but additive nature (new tables) reduces complexity.

scope.notes: Will create 1 new migration file, potentially touch SQLAlchemy models (if they don't exist yet), and may need to verify existing migration patterns. Contained to backend service database layer.

integrations.notes: Alembic is already configured in the project (confirmed in project_index.json line 75). Standard PostgreSQL + SQLAlchemy stack. No external APIs or services involved.

infrastructure.notes: Database schema changes (5 new tables + indexes). Alembic already configured with alembic.ini and migrations directory at alembic/versions. No Docker or environment config changes needed.

knowledge.notes: Alembic is standard Python migration tool. Project already uses it (migration commands documented in project_index). Should have existing migration files to follow as patterns.

concerns: Database schema changes are not easily reversible
Need to ensure proper index creation for performance
Migration must run cleanly on existing database
Junction table relationships must be correctly defined
risk.notes: Risk is medium but manageable. These are new tables (additive), not modifying existing data. Proper testing of migration up/down is critical.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Database migrations require validation to ensure they run cleanly. Unit tests for model definitions and integration tests to verify migration up/down work correctly. No security-sensitive data or auth changes involved.
